name: Ensure initializing cryptographic key generators (JEE)
description:
This rules reports :
  - usage of the KeyGenerator class without calling the init() method
  - usage of the KeyPairGenerator class without calling the initialize() method

It is focused on Java's standard cryptographic API, provided by the Java Cryptography Architecture (JCA), part of the JDK.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: Using default parameters when generating keys can result in weaker encryption than advertised by the algorithm.
reference:
CWE-325: Missing Cryptographic Step
https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/325.html

OWASP Top 10:2021 - A02:2021 - Cryptographic Failures
https://owasp.org/Top10/A02_2021-Cryptographic_Failures/
remediation: Explicitly set the recommended parameters for the cryptographic algorithm you are using (for instance a 2048-bit key for the RSA algorithm).
alternativeName: Avoid using default parameters of key generators

technicalCriteria.name: PCI-DSS4-Requirement-8.3.2 - Strong cryptography is used to render all authentication factors unreadable during transmission and storage on all system components.
PCI-Requirement-4.1 - Use strong cryptography and security protocols
